III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
 MISEP requirements do not apply as this licensee does not have contract with
MDHHS.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
 DHHS policy/contract requirements do not apply as this licensee does not have
contract with MDHHS.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
This agency has not had any licensing complaints and have not been found in
violation of any licensing rules for the past two years.
Chief Administrator Assessment – The chief administrator assessment was
provided and discussed. The assessment indicated that the agency had experienced
more staffing turnover in the last year than they have historically experienced.
Interviews – The staff members interviewed reported no concerns.
VII. DCWL Analyst Concerns
Not applicable as this agency is not contracted with MDHHS.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
